info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 5:28PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF PERRY...JUNIATA...AND DAUPHIN COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of 20 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 526 PM EST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 18 miles southwest of Mifflinburg to near Lewistown and moving east at 30 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Mcalisterville around 530 PM EST. Richfield around 535 PM EST. New Bloomfield around 600 PM EST. Newport around 605 PM EST. Elizabethville around 610 PM EST. Duncannon around 615 PM EST. Motorists traveling along US-322 between Lewistown and Duncannon should be prepared for rapidly-changing road conditions. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
